posts.author: Moredhel
posts.content:
Hey guys, me again

I was hoping someone (and that someone will be Max, I'm sure *grin*) could give me a good build for an (obviously) evil monk/shadow dancer/assassin. The idea for it came up after re-reading my topic about the evil rogue/cleric/blackguard-request. While I enjoy all-out combat it's also cool to just sit back and shoot arrows or sneak around and backstab the enemy to death!

Not sure about race and weapon focus. I could pick human for extra stuff, or elf and give him a black skin and white hair and see him as a drow (no I will NOT install various hakpacks to get the real drow race), or have a typical elf who has a different view on life and, well, death (much like Grimgnaw). For weapons I could stick to the monk's favorite kama's, but short swords and kukri's could be funky as well.

Maybe it's better to play him as
1) rogue instead of monk, but then you have your standard setup for backstabbers;
2) rogue instead of assassin, but that feels less evil.
3) rogue instead of shadow dancer, ditching the HiPS.

I'd like to ask about a build wherein I can get all three classes at lvl 10 or so, since I don't really like waiting X lvls for the first lvl of class Y to be added, like THIS build I found after a quick "nwn monk/sd/assassin" search on google. Thanks in advance!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Moredhel wrote:Thanks for that guide! Am I correct in reading it as "if an enemy is fighting my party member, I cannot attempt a death attack" ?
The death attack consists of 2 components:
1) An attempt to paralyze the target
For the paralyzing attempt to occur, the target must be flat-footed when attacked, and the attack must hit.
The target is then forced to roll a fortitude save vs. the DC of the death attack. If he fails the roll, he will be paralyzed for 1 turn per assassin level.
2) A damage bonus
The death attack damage bonus works like the sneak attack of the rogue and blackguard. The death attack damage will be dealt to flat-footed and prone creatures, as well as creatures already in combat as long as they do not fight the assassin directly.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
The screenshot shows that you dual wield the kamas.
If you follow the build progression as it is posted, you don't have any two weapon fighting feats yet.

Your AB at level 10 with your equipment is +14/+11 with the main hand weapon and +10 off hand. With TWF and Ambidex the AB would be +16/+13 with the main hand and +16 off hand.
Your AB will be +18/+15 if you switch to a single kama.

The build is meant to start dual wielding at level 15 when you have both TWF and Ambidex. It is possible to start taking the two weapon fighting feats earlier if you delay WF Kama. Then you can have TWF at level 9 and Ambidex at level 12.

From your reports I understand that the character works well after all, I guess that either demonstrates how easy the OC is or how powerful an assassin with HIPS is.

When you start trying new things, (other modules but especialy some good PW's) and you get some experiance, you will someday turn back and wonder.. How did i thought that thing difficult?

I remember way back into 2005 at the original boards of Bioware, people complaining about that Balor in last act. " I can't hurt it! Please help!! " And the fun was that the game was offering +3 weapon in abudance actually..


It's all a matter of experiance, you can't become better at chess if you keep facing the same low skill opponents. You have to get beaten by a better player and start thinking, why you lost.
